snippet: In the Eastern District of New York, for example, individual judges’ median drug sentences varied from 12 to 64 months.
abstract: Analysis of hundreds of thousands of federal court cases finds vast disparities in prison sentences handed down by judges presiding over similar cases, raising questions about the extent to which federal sentences are influenced by particular judges rather than by circumstances of the cases; trove of data subjects individual district court judges to level of scrutiny unprecedented in history of judiciary.
lead_paragraph: In the Eastern District of New York, for example, individual judges’ median drug sentences varied from 12 to 64 months.

headline.seo: Wide Sentencing Disparity Found Among U.S. Judges
headline.main: Wide Sentencing Disparity Found Among U.S. Judges
headline.print_headline: Big Sentencing Disparity Seen for Judges
